item.title: Daily Rundown 04/26/2021
item.description: Photo from Pixabay I don’t know about you but I made some great progress reading through yesterday’s giant list of links. I promise that today’s won’t be nearly as dense. It might even be a little fun. Read on. Deploying your own Cryptocurrency network with Docker and Nano NanoAddr.io - Nano Vanity Address Generator Ethereum and Cross-chain atomic swaps Build your own Ethereum token in less than an hour Methods to wrap ERC721 tokens WebAssembly and React NanoPOW-RS NodeJS Wrapper Create your own cryptocurrency TokenMint Create a cryptocurrency token for free in under 10 minutes 0x Launch Kit Using Hardhat with Binance Smart Chain AAVE Flash Loan Docs Furucombo - Drag and drop DeFi strategies PancakeBunny Finance
item.content:
Photo from Pixabay

I don’t know about you but I made some great progress reading through yesterday’s giant list of links. I promise that today’s won’t be nearly as dense. It might even be a little fun. Read on.

  • Deploying your own Cryptocurrency network with Docker and Nano
  • NanoAddr.io - Nano Vanity Address Generator
  • Ethereum and Cross-chain atomic swaps
  • Build your own Ethereum token in less than an hour
  • Methods to wrap ERC721 tokens
  • WebAssembly and React
  • NanoPOW-RS NodeJS Wrapper
  • Create your own cryptocurrency
  • TokenMint
  • Create a cryptocurrency token for free in under 10 minutes
  • 0x Launch Kit
  • Using Hardhat with Binance Smart Chain
  • AAVE Flash Loan Docs
  • Furucombo - Drag and drop DeFi strategies
  • PancakeBunny Finance

item.title: Daily Rundown 04/25/2021
item.description: Photo from Pixabay I finally started digging into my backlog of articles to research, which mostly consists of a bunch of Google Chrome tabs. Below are some interesting reads: Things to consider if you want to launch a crypto token Creating a smart contract from another smart contract Wrapped BAN? It’s coming! CryptomonKeys collectible NFTs via Alien Worlds [reddit] Why should your business accept $NANO Easy Amazon EC2 Instance Comparison TickerRain does sentiment analysis related to stocks on reddit Freqtrade, open source crypto trading bot The Coin Perspective, if other tokens had Bitcoin’s market cap Learn Docker the easy way Priceless: The Myth of Fair Value Multi-signature in NANO Send cryptographically secure messages via NANO blocks The Blockchain Trilemma The Great Crypto Heist SQLite is not a toy
item.content:
Photo from Pixabay

I finally started digging into my backlog of articles to research, which mostly consists of a bunch of Google Chrome tabs. Below are some interesting reads:

  • Things to consider if you want to launch a crypto token
  • Creating a smart contract from another smart contract
  • Wrapped BAN? It’s coming!
  • CryptomonKeys collectible NFTs via Alien Worlds [reddit]
  • Why should your business accept $NANO
  • Easy Amazon EC2 Instance Comparison
  • TickerRain does sentiment analysis related to stocks on reddit
  • Freqtrade, open source crypto trading bot
  • The Coin Perspective, if other tokens had Bitcoin’s market cap
  • Learn Docker the easy way
  • Priceless: The Myth of Fair Value
  • Multi-signature in NANO
  • Send cryptographically secure messages via NANO blocks
  • The Blockchain Trilemma
  • The Great Crypto Heist
  • SQLite is not a toy
